Dor-lómin was the southwestern part of Hithlum
column2: bordered in the east by the Mountains of Mithrim
column3: and in the north by the river which formed the Cirith Ninniach
column4: also known as Annon-in-Gelydh ("Gate of the Noldor").

column1: It was first colonized by the Noldor shortly after they arrived in Middle-earth
column2: and for a long time was ruled by Fingon son of Fingolfin
column3: before he took over as High King of the Noldor after his father was killed.

column1: By this time the Edain known as the House of Hador had entered Beleriand
column2: and Hador Lórindol had "entered the household of Fingolfin in his youth and was loved by the King." Fingolfin granted him the land of Dor-lómin as a fief
column3: and he gathered most of his kin into that land.

column1: Húrins house was built in its southeastern corner near the mountain known as Amon Darthir
column2: where the river Nen Lalaith began.

column1: Tuor son of Huor was fostered by the Elves of Androth in the Mountains of Mithrim
After the Nirnaeth Arnoediad ("Battle of Unnumbered Tears")
column2: the House of Hador was destroyed or scattered
it was destroyed during the War of Wrath.
